defs.docs:
`font-kit` provides a common interface to the various system font libraries and provides
 services such as finding fonts on the system, performing nearest-font matching, and rasterizing
 glyphs.

attributes.value: / `font-kit` provides a common interface to the various system font libraries and provides
/ services such as finding fonts on the system, performing nearest-font matching, and rasterizing
/ glyphs.
/ ## Synopsis
/     # extern crate euclid;
/     # extern crate font_kit;
/     use euclid::{Point2D, Size2D};
/     use font_kit::canvas::{Canvas, Format, RasterizationOptions};
/     use font_kit::family_name::FamilyName;
/     use font_kit::hinting::HintingOptions;
/     use font_kit::properties::Properties;
/     use font_kit::source::SystemSource;
/     use font_kit::loader::FontTransform;
/     let font = SystemSource::new().select_best_match(&[FamilyName::SansSerif],
/                                                      &Properties::new())
/                                   .unwrap()
/                                   .load()
/                                   .unwrap();
/     let glyph_id = font.glyph_for_char('A').unwrap();
/     let mut canvas = Canvas::new(&Size2D::new(32, 32), Format::A8);
/     font.rasterize_glyph(&mut canvas,
/                          glyph_id,
/                          &FontTransform::identity(),
/                          HintingOptions::None,
/                          RasterizationOptions::GrayscaleAa)
/         .unwrap();
/ ## Backends
/ `font-kit` delegates to system libraries to perform tasks. It has two types of backends: a
/ *source* and a *loader*. Sources are platform font databases; they allow lookup of installed
/ fonts by name or attributes. Loaders are font loading libraries; they allow font files (TTF,
/ OTF, etc.) to be loaded from a file on disk or from bytes in memory. Sources and loaders can be
/ freely intermixed at runtime; fonts can be looked up via DirectWrite and rendered via FreeType,
/ for example.
/ Available loaders:
/ * Core Text (macOS): The system font loader on macOS. Does not do hinting except when bilevel
/   rendering is in use.
/ * DirectWrite (Windows): The newer system framework for text rendering on Windows. Does
/   vertical hinting but not full hinting.
/ * FreeType (cross-platform): A full-featured font rendering framework.
/ Available sources:
/ * Core Text (macOS): The system font database on macOS.
/ * DirectWrite (Windows): The newer API to query the system font database on Windows.
/ * Fontconfig (cross-platform): A technically platform-neutral, but in practice Unix-specific,
/   API to query and match fonts.
/ * Filesystem (cross-platform): A simple source that reads fonts from a path on disk. This is
/   the default on Android.
/ * Memory (cross-platform): A source that reads from a fixed set of fonts in memory.
/ * Multi (cross-platform): A source that allows multiple sources to be queried at once.
/ On Windows and macOS, the FreeType loader and the Fontconfig source are not built by default.
/ To build them, use the `loader-freetype` and `source-fontconfig` Cargo features respectively.
/ If you want them to be the default, instead use the `loader-freetype-default` and
/ `source-fontconfig-default` Cargo features respectively. Beware that
/ `source-fontconfig-default` is rarely what you want on those two platforms!
/ ## Features
/ `font-kit` is capable of doing the following:
/ * Loading fonts from files or memory.
/ * Determining whether files on disk or in memory represent fonts.
/ * Interoperating with native font APIs.
/ * Querying various metadata about fonts.
/ * Doing simple glyph-to-character mapping. (For more complex use cases, a shaper is required;
/   proper shaping is beyond the scope of `font-kit`.)
/ * Reading unhinted or hinted vector outlines from glyphs.
/ * Calculating glyph and font metrics.
/ * Looking up glyph advances and origins.
/ * Rasterizing glyphs using the native rasterizer, optionally using hinting. (Custom
/   rasterizers, such as Pathfinder, can be used in conjuction with the outline API.)
/ * Looking up all fonts on the system.
/ * Searching for specific fonts by family or PostScript name.
/ * Performing font matching according to the [CSS Fonts Module Level 3] specification.
/ ## License
/ `font-kit` is licensed under the same terms as Rust itself.
/ [CSS Fonts Module Level 3]: https://drafts.csswg.org/css-fonts-3/#font-matching-algorithm
warn(missing_docs)
warn(missing_debug_implementations)
warn(missing_copy_implementations)

defs.name: new
defs.docs: Creates a new blank canvas with the given pixel size and format.

attributes.value: / Creates a new blank canvas with the given pixel size and format.
/ Stride is automatically calculated from width.
/ The canvas is initialized with transparent black (all values 0).

defs.name: NoSuchFontInCollection
defs.docs: Attempted to load an invalid index in a TrueType or OpenType font collection.

attributes.value: / Attempted to load an invalid index in a TrueType or OpenType font collection.
/ For example, if a `.ttc` file has 2 fonts in it, and you ask for the 5th one, you'll get
/ this error.

defs.docs: Attempted to load a malformed or corrupted font.

defs.name: family_name
defs.docs: A possible value for the `font-family` CSS property.

attributes.value: / A possible value for the `font-family` CSS property.

defs.name: Title
defs.docs: A specific font family, specified by name: e.g. "Arial", "times".

attributes.value: / A specific font family, specified by name: e.g. "Arial", "times".

defs.name: Serif
defs.docs: Serif fonts represent the formal text style for a script.

attributes.value: / Serif fonts represent the formal text style for a script.

defs.name: SansSerif
defs.docs:
Glyphs in sans-serif fonts, as the term is used in CSS, are generally low contrast
 (vertical and horizontal stems have the close to the same thickness) and have stroke
 endings that are plain — without any flaring, cross stroke, or other ornamentation.

attributes.value: / Glyphs in sans-serif fonts, as the term is used in CSS, are generally low contrast
/ (vertical and horizontal stems have the close to the same thickness) and have stroke
/ endings that are plain — without any flaring, cross stroke, or other ornamentation.

defs.name: Monospace
defs.docs: The sole criterion of a monospace font is that all glyphs have the same fixed width.

attributes.value: / The sole criterion of a monospace font is that all glyphs have the same fixed width.

defs.name: Cursive
defs.docs:
Glyphs in cursive fonts generally use a more informal script style, and the result looks
 more like handwritten pen or brush writing than printed letterwork.

attributes.value: / Glyphs in cursive fonts generally use a more informal script style, and the result looks
/ more like handwritten pen or brush writing than printed letterwork.

defs.name: Fantasy
defs.docs:
Fantasy fonts are primarily decorative or expressive fonts that contain decorative or
 expressive representations of characters.

attributes.value: / Fantasy fonts are primarily decorative or expressive fonts that contain decorative or
/ expressive representations of characters.

defs.name: FamilyName
defs.docs: A possible value for the `font-family` CSS property.

attributes.value: / A possible value for the `font-family` CSS property.
/ These descriptions are taken from CSS Fonts Level 3 § 3.1:
/ https://drafts.csswg.org/css-fonts-3/#font-family-prop.
/ TODO(pcwalton): `system-ui`, `emoji`, `math`, `fangsong`

defs.name: font
defs.docs: A font face loaded into memory.

attributes.value: / A font face loaded into memory.
/ The Font type in this crate represents the default loader.

defs.name: handle
defs.docs: Encapsulates the information needed to locate and open a font.

attributes.value: / Encapsulates the information needed to locate and open a font.
/ This is either the path to the font or the raw in-memory font data.
/ To open the font referenced by a handle, use a loader.

defs.name: Path
defs.docs: A font on disk referenced by a path.

attributes.value: / A font on disk referenced by a path.

defs.name: Memory
defs.docs: A font in memory.

attributes.value: / A font in memory.

defs.name: Handle
defs.docs: Encapsulates the information needed to locate and open a font.

attributes.value: / Encapsulates the information needed to locate and open a font.
/ This is either the path to the font or the raw in-memory font data.
/ To open the font referenced by a handle, use a loader.

defs.name: from_path
defs.docs: Creates a new handle from a path.

attributes.value: / Creates a new handle from a path.
/ `font_index` specifies the index of the font to choose if the path points to a font
/ collection. If the path points to a single font file, pass 0.
inline

defs.name: from_memory
defs.docs: Creates a new handle from raw TTF/OTF/etc. data in memory.

attributes.value: / Creates a new handle from raw TTF/OTF/etc. data in memory.
/ `font_index` specifies the index of the font to choose if the memory represents a font
/ collection. If the memory represents a single font file, pass 0.
inline

defs.name: load
defs.docs: A convenience method to load this handle with the default loader, producing a Font.

attributes.value: / A convenience method to load this handle with the default loader, producing a Font.
inline

defs.name: hinting
defs.docs: Specifies how hinting (grid fitting) is to be performed (or not performed) for a glyph.

attributes.value: / Specifies how hinting (grid fitting) is to be performed (or not performed) for a glyph.
/ This affects both outlines and rasterization.

defs.name: None
defs.docs: No hinting is performed unless absolutely necessary to assemble the glyph.

attributes.value: / No hinting is performed unless absolutely necessary to assemble the glyph.
/ This corresponds to what macOS and FreeType in its "no hinting" mode do.

defs.name: Vertical
defs.docs:
Hinting is performed only in the vertical direction. The specified point size is used for
 grid fitting.

attributes.value: / Hinting is performed only in the vertical direction. The specified point size is used for
/ grid fitting.
/ This corresponds to what DirectWrite and FreeType in its light hinting mode do.

defs.name: VerticalSubpixel
defs.docs:
Hinting is performed only in the vertical direction, and further tweaks are applied to make
 subpixel antialiasing look better. The specified point size is used for grid fitting.

attributes.value: / Hinting is performed only in the vertical direction, and further tweaks are applied to make
/ subpixel antialiasing look better. The specified point size is used for grid fitting.
/ This matches DirectWrite, GDI in its ClearType mode, and FreeType in its LCD hinting mode.

defs.name: Full
defs.docs:
Hinting is performed in both horizontal and vertical directions. The specified point size
 is used for grid fitting.

attributes.value: / Hinting is performed in both horizontal and vertical directions. The specified point size
/ is used for grid fitting.
/ This corresponds to what GDI in non-ClearType modes and FreeType in its normal hinting mode
/ do.

defs.name: HintingOptions
defs.docs: Specifies how hinting (grid fitting) is to be performed (or not performed) for a glyph.

attributes.value: / Specifies how hinting (grid fitting) is to be performed (or not performed) for a glyph.
/ This affects both outlines and rasterization.

defs.name: grid_fitting_size
defs.docs: Returns the point size that will be used for grid fitting, if any.

attributes.value: / Returns the point size that will be used for grid fitting, if any.
inline

attributes.value: / Loads a font from raw font data (the contents of a `.ttf`/`.otf`/etc. file).

/ If the file is a collection (`.ttc`/`.otc`/etc.), `font_index` specifies the index of the
/ font to load from it. If the file represents a single font, pass 0 for `font_index`.

defs.docs: Returns the wrapped native font handle.

attributes.value: / Returns the wrapped native font handle.

attributes.value: / Returns the PostScript name of the font. This should be globally unique.

defs.docs: Returns the full name of the font (also known as "display name" on macOS).

attributes.value: / Returns the full name of the font (also known as "display name" on macOS).

defs.name: properties
defs.docs: Returns the values of various font properties, corresponding to those defined in CSS.

attributes.value: / Returns the values of various font properties, corresponding to those defined in CSS.

defs.name: glyph_count
defs.docs: Returns the number of glyphs in the font.

attributes.value: / Returns the number of glyphs in the font.
/ Glyph IDs range from 0 inclusive to this value exclusive.

defs.name: glyph_for_char
defs.docs: Returns the usual glyph ID for a Unicode character.

attributes.value: / Returns the usual glyph ID for a Unicode character.
/ Be careful with this function; typographically correct character-to-glyph mapping must be
/ done using a *shaper* such as HarfBuzz. This function is only useful for best-effort simple
/ use cases like "what does character X look like on its own".

defs.name: glyph_by_name
defs.docs: Returns the glyph ID for the specified glyph name.

attributes.value: / Returns the glyph ID for the specified glyph name.
inline

defs.name: outline
defs.value:
pub fn outline<B>(&Self, u32, HintingOptions, &mut B)
-> Result<(), GlyphLoadingError> where B: PathBuilder
defs.docs: Sends the vector path for a glyph to a path builder.

attributes.value: / Sends the vector path for a glyph to a path builder.
/ If `hinting_mode` is not None, this function performs grid-fitting as requested before
/ sending the hinding outlines to the builder.
/ TODO(pcwalton): What should we do for bitmap glyphs?

defs.docs: Returns the boundaries of a glyph in font units.

Returns the distance from the origin of the glyph with the given ID to the next, in font

/ units.

defs.name: metrics
defs.docs: Retrieves various metrics that apply to the entire font.

attributes.value: / Retrieves various metrics that apply to the entire font.

defs.name: handle
defs.docs: Returns a handle to this font, if possible.

attributes.value: / Returns a handle to this font, if possible.
/ This is useful if you want to open the font with a different loader.

defs.name: copy_font_data
defs.docs: Attempts to return the raw font data (contents of the font file).

attributes.value: / Attempts to return the raw font data (contents of the font file).
/ If this font is a member of a collection, this function returns the data for the entire
/ collection.

defs.name: supports_hinting_options
defs.value: pub fn supports_hinting_options(&Self, HintingOptions, bool) -> bool
defs.docs: Returns true if and only if the font loader can perform hinting in the requested way.

attributes.value: / Returns true if and only if the font loader can perform hinting in the requested way.
/ Some APIs support only rasterizing glyphs with hinting, not retriving hinted outlines. If
/ `for_rasterization` is false, this function returns true if and only if the loader supports
/ retrieval of hinted *outlines*. If `for_rasterization` is true, this function returns true
/ if and only if the loader supports *rasterizing* hinted glyphs.

defs.name: raster_bounds
defs.value:
pub fn raster_bounds(&Self, u32, f32, &FontTransform, &Point2D<f32>,
                     HintingOptions, RasterizationOptions)
-> Result<Rect<i32>, GlyphLoadingError>
defs.docs:
Returns the pixel boundaries that the glyph will take up when rendered using this loader's
 rasterizer at the given `point_size`, `transform` and `origin`. `origin` is not transformed
 by `transform`.

attributes.value: / Returns the pixel boundaries that the glyph will take up when rendered using this loader's
/ rasterizer at the given `point_size`, `transform` and `origin`. `origin` is not transformed
/ by `transform`.

defs.name: rasterize_glyph
defs.value:
pub fn rasterize_glyph(&Self, &mut Canvas, u32, f32, &FontTransform,
                       &Point2D<f32>, HintingOptions, RasterizationOptions)
-> Result<(), GlyphLoadingError>
defs.docs: Rasterizes a glyph to a canvas with the given size and origin.

attributes.value: / Rasterizes a glyph to a canvas with the given size and origin.
/ Format conversion will be performed if the canvas format does not match the rasterization
/ options. For example, if bilevel (black and white) rendering is requested to an RGBA
/ surface, this function will automatically convert the 1-bit raster image to the 32-bit
/ format of the canvas. Note that this may result in a performance penalty, depending on the
/ loader.
/ If `hinting_options` is not None, the requested grid fitting is performed.
/ `origin` is not transformed by `transform`.

defs.name: get_fallbacks
defs.docs: Get font fallback results for the given text and locale.

attributes.value: / Get font fallback results for the given text and locale.
/ The `locale` argument is a language tag such as `"en-US"` or `"zh-Hans-CN"`.

attributes.value:
cfg(any(not(any(target_os = "macos", target_family = "windows")), feature =
          "loader-freetype"))
/ A cross-platform loader that uses the FreeType library to load and rasterize fonts.
/ On macOS and Windows, the Cargo feature `loader-freetype-default` can be used to opt into this
/ loader by default.

defs.name: NativeFont
defs.docs: The handle that the FreeType API natively uses to represent a font.

attributes.value: / The handle that the FreeType API natively uses to represent a font.

defs.name: Font
defs.docs: A cross-platform loader that uses the FreeType library to load and rasterize fonts.

attributes.value: / A cross-platform loader that uses the FreeType library to load and rasterize fonts.
/ On macOS and Windows, the Cargo feature `loader-freetype-default` can be used to opt into this
/ loader by default.

defs.name: from_bytes
defs.value: pub fn from_bytes(Arc<Vec<u8>>, u32) -> Result<Font, FontLoadingError>
defs.docs: Loads a font from raw font data (the contents of a `.ttf`/`.otf`/etc. file).

attributes.value: / Loads a font from raw font data (the contents of a `.ttf`/`.otf`/etc. file).
/ If the data represents a collection (`.ttc`/`.otc`/etc.), `font_index` specifies the index
/ of the font to load from it. If the data represents a single font, pass 0 for `font_index`.

defs.name: from_file
defs.value: pub fn from_file(&mut File, u32) -> Result<Font, FontLoadingError>
defs.docs: Loads a font from a `.ttf`/`.otf`/etc. file.

attributes.value: / Loads a font from a `.ttf`/`.otf`/etc. file.
/ If the file is a collection (`.ttc`/`.otc`/etc.), `font_index` specifies the index of the
/ font to load from it. If the file represents a single font, pass 0 for `font_index`.
cfg(not(target_arch = "wasm32"))

defs.name: from_path
defs.value:
pub fn from_path

(P, u32) -> Result where P: AsRef
defs.docs: Loads a font from the path to a `.ttf`/`.otf`/etc. file.

attributes.value: / Loads a font from the path to a `.ttf`/`.otf`/etc. file.
/ If the file is a collection (`.ttc`/`.otc`/etc.), `font_index` specifies the index of the
/ font to load from it. If the file represents a single font, pass 0 for `font_index`.
inline
cfg(not(target_arch = "wasm32"))

defs.name: native_font
defs.docs: Returns the wrapped native font handle.

attributes.value: / Returns the wrapped native font handle.
/ This function increments the reference count of the FreeType face before returning it.
/ Therefore, it is the caller's responsibility to free it with `FT_Done_Face`.

defs.name: glyph_for_char
defs.docs: Returns the usual glyph ID for a Unicode character.

attributes.value: / Returns the usual glyph ID for a Unicode character.
/ Be careful with this function; typographically correct character-to-glyph mapping must be
/ done using a *shaper* such as HarfBuzz. This function is only useful for best-effort simple
/ use cases like "what does character X look like on its own".
inline

defs.name: glyph_by_name
defs.docs: Returns the glyph ID for the specified glyph name.

attributes.value: / Returns the glyph ID for the specified glyph name.
inline

defs.name: glyph_count
defs.docs: Returns the number of glyphs in the font.

attributes.value: / Returns the number of glyphs in the font.
/ Glyph IDs range from 0 inclusive to this value exclusive.
inline

defs.name: outline
defs.value:
pub fn outline<B>(&Self, u32, HintingOptions, &mut B)
-> Result<(), GlyphLoadingError> where B: PathBuilder
defs.docs: Sends the vector path for a glyph to a path builder.

attributes.value: / Sends the vector path for a glyph to a path builder.
/ If `hinting_mode` is not None, this function performs grid-fitting as requested before
/ sending the hinding outlines to the builder.
/ TODO(pcwalton): What should we do for bitmap glyphs?

defs.name: rasterize_glyph
defs.value:
pub fn rasterize_glyph(&Self, &mut Canvas, u32, f32, &FontTransform,
                       &Point2D<f32>, HintingOptions, RasterizationOptions)
-> Result<(), GlyphLoadingError>
defs.docs: Rasterizes a glyph to a canvas with the given size and origin.

attributes.value: / Rasterizes a glyph to a canvas with the given size and origin.
/ Format conversion will be performed if the canvas format does not match the rasterization
/ options. For example, if bilevel (black and white) rendering is requested to an RGBA
/ surface, this function will automatically convert the 1-bit raster image to the 32-bit
/ format of the canvas. Note that this may result in a performance penalty, depending on the
/ loader.
/ If `hinting_options` is not None, the requested grid fitting is performed.

defs.name: handle
defs.docs: Returns a handle to this font, if possible.

attributes.value: / Returns a handle to this font, if possible.
/ This is useful if you want to open the font with a different loader.
inline

defs.name: copy_font_data
defs.docs: Attempts to return the raw font data (contents of the font file).

attributes.value: / Attempts to return the raw font data (contents of the font file).
/ If this font is a member of a collection, this function returns the data for the entire
/ collection.

defs.name: metrics
defs.docs: Various metrics that apply to the entire font.

attributes.value: / Various metrics that apply to the entire font.
/ For OpenType fonts, these mostly come from the `OS/2` table.

defs.name: Metrics
defs.value: Metrics { units_per_em, ascent, descent, line_gap, underline_position, underline_thickness, cap_height, x_height }
defs.docs: Various metrics that apply to the entire font.

attributes.value: / Various metrics that apply to the entire font.
/ For OpenType fonts, these mostly come from the `OS/2` table.

defs.name: units_per_em
defs.docs: The number of font units per em.

attributes.value: / The number of font units per em.
/ Font sizes are usually expressed in pixels per em; e.g. `12px` means 12 pixels per em.

defs.name: ascent
defs.docs: The maximum amount the font rises above the baseline, in font units.

attributes.value: / The maximum amount the font rises above the baseline, in font units.

defs.name: descent
defs.docs: The maximum amount the font descends below the baseline, in font units.

attributes.value: / The maximum amount the font descends below the baseline, in font units.
/ NB: This is typically a negative value to match the definition of `sTypoDescender` in the
/ `OS/2` table in the OpenType specification. If you are used to using Windows or Mac APIs,
/ beware, as the sign is reversed from what those APIs return.

defs.name: line_gap
defs.docs: Distance between baselines, in font units.

attributes.value: / Distance between baselines, in font units.

defs.name: underline_position
defs.docs:
The suggested distance of the top of the underline from the baseline (negative values
 indicate below baseline), in font units.

attributes.value: / The suggested distance of the top of the underline from the baseline (negative values
/ indicate below baseline), in font units.

defs.name: underline_thickness
defs.docs: A suggested value for the underline thickness, in font units.

attributes.value: / A suggested value for the underline thickness, in font units.

defs.name: cap_height
defs.docs: The approximate amount that uppercase letters rise above the baseline, in font units.

attributes.value: / The approximate amount that uppercase letters rise above the baseline, in font units.

defs.name: x_height
defs.docs:
The approximate amount that non-ascending lowercase letters rise above the baseline, in
 font units.

attributes.value: / The approximate amount that non-ascending lowercase letters rise above the baseline, in
/ font units.

defs.name: sources
defs.docs: Various databases of installed fonts that can be queried.

attributes.value: / Various databases of installed fonts that can be queried.
/ The system-specific sources (Core Text, DirectWrite, and Fontconfig) contain the fonts that are
/ installed on the system. The remaining databases (`fs`, `mem`, and `multi`) allow `font-kit` to
/ query fonts not installed on the system.

defs.name: fontconfig
defs.docs:
A source that contains the fonts installed on the system, as reported by the Fontconfig
 library.

attributes.value:
cfg(any(not(any(target_os = "macos", target_family = "windows", target_arch
                  = "wasm32")), feature = "source-fontconfig"))
/ A source that contains the fonts installed on the system, as reported by the Fontconfig
/ library.
/ On macOS and Windows, the Cargo feature `source-fontconfig` can be used to opt into fontconfig
/ support. To prefer it over the native font source (only if you know what you're doing), use the
/ `source-fontconfig-default` feature.

defs.name: FontconfigSource
defs.docs:
A source that contains the fonts installed on the system, as reported by the Fontconfig
 library.

attributes.value: / A source that contains the fonts installed on the system, as reported by the Fontconfig
/ library.
/ On macOS and Windows, the Cargo feature `source-fontconfig` can be used to opt into fontconfig
/ support. To prefer it over the native font source (only if you know what you're doing), use the
/ `source-fontconfig-default` feature.
allow(missing_debug_implementations)

defs.name: new
defs.docs: Opens the default set of directories on this platform and indexes the fonts found within.

attributes.value: / Opens the default set of directories on this platform and indexes the fonts found within.
/ Do not rely on this function for systems other than Android. It makes a best effort to
/ locate fonts in the typical platform directories, but it is too simple to pick up fonts
/ that are stored in unusual locations but nevertheless properly installed.

defs.name: mem
defs.docs: A source that keeps fonts in memory.

defs.docs: A source that keeps fonts in memory.

attributes.value: / A source that keeps fonts in memory.

defs.name: from_fonts
defs.value:
pub fn from_fonts<I>(I) -> Result<MemSource, FontLoadingError> where
I: Iterator<Item = Handle>
defs.docs: Creates a new memory source that contains the given set of font handles.

attributes.value: / Creates a new memory source that contains the given set of font handles.
/ The fonts referenced by the handles are eagerly loaded into memory.

defs.name: all_fonts
defs.docs: Returns paths of all fonts installed on the system.

attributes.value: / Returns paths of all fonts installed on the system.

defs.name: select_family_by_name
defs.docs: Looks up a font family by name and returns the handles of all the fonts in that family.

attributes.value: / Looks up a font family by name and returns the handles of all the fonts in that family.

defs.name: select_by_postscript_name
defs.docs: Selects a font by PostScript name, which should be a unique identifier.

attributes.value: / Selects a font by PostScript name, which should be a unique identifier.
/ The default implementation, which is used by the DirectWrite and the filesystem backends,
/ does a brute-force search of installed fonts to find the one that matches.

 handle.

defs.name: multi
defs.docs: A source that encapsulates multiple sources and allows them to be queried as a group.

attributes.value: / A source that encapsulates multiple sources and allows them to be queried as a group.
/ This is useful when an application wants a library of fonts consisting of the installed system
/ fonts plus some other application-supplied fonts.

defs.name: MultiSource
defs.docs: A source that encapsulates multiple sources and allows them to be queried as a group.

attributes.value: / A source that encapsulates multiple sources and allows them to be queried as a group.
/ This is useful when an application wants a library of fonts consisting of the installed system
/ fonts plus some other application-supplied fonts.
